title.narrative: Humanitarian assistance to IDPs, Refugees and Asylum Seekers and Affected Population

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to improve access to basic services and needs of the most vulnerable IDPs, refugees, asylum seekers and non-displaced people in need in Libya. UNHCR will use CERF to distribute NFI kits to refugees, asylum seekers and IDPs in Benghazi and surrounding areas, and provide multipurpose cash grants to highly vulnerable IDPs and non-displaced people in need in Benghazi, Sebha and surrounding areas. An estimated 12,250 people will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within nine months.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Southern (Sabha and Ubari) and Eastern (Benghazi), Libya

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Humanitarian assistance to IDPs, Refugees and Asylum Seekers and Affected Population

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS LIBYA UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
